description: English transliteration of Hindi बहादुर (bahādur, “brave, valiant”), from Persian بهادر‎ (bahâdor).

entries.meaning: (India, historical) A Mughal honorific connoting martial courage and valor, suffixed to name or title, which it raises by half a degree. Commonly bestowed upon loyal princes and victorious military commanders by Mughal emperors, and later by their British successors.
